alert.note: Alert for Monroe (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 09 at 4:36PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of north central Monroe County through 515 PM CDT... At 436 PM CDT, National Weather Service doppler radar indicated a strong thunderstorm 11 miles southwest of Vredenburgh, or 14 miles northwest of Monroeville. This storm was nearly stationary. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of north central Monroe County. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
